etymology.description: 济(濟 ‘Ji River’) + 南 ‘south’ = south of the Ji River; city name.
etymology.interpretation: Originally meant “south of the Ji River (濟水之南),” marking its location relative to the ancient Ji River. Later fixed as the proper name of the city, now the capital of Shandong.
etymology.simplification: 濟 → 济 by simplifying the phonetic 齊 to 齐 and reducing strokes; the water radical 氵 is retained. 南 is unchanged.

parts.english: Ji River (ancient); to aid; to relieve; to ferry across

examples.chinese: 济南是山东省的省会(濟南是山東省的省會)。
examples.pinyin: Jǐnán shì Shāndōng shěng de shěnghuì.
examples.english: Jinan is the capital of Shandong Province.

examples.chinese: 名称源自“济水之南”，意为在济水以南的地方(名稱源自「濟水之南」，意為在濟水以南的地方)。
examples.pinyin: Míngchēng yuánzì “Jìshuǐ zhī nán”, yìwéi zài Jìshuǐ yǐ nán de dìfāng.
examples.english: The name comes from “south of the Ji River,” meaning a place south of the Ji River.

examples.chinese: 古籍常以“济南”指济水以南的区域(古籍常以「濟南」指濟水以南的區域)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔjí cháng yǐ “Jǐnán” zhǐ Jìshuǐ yǐ nán de qūyù.
examples.english: Classical texts often use “Jinan” to refer to the region south of the Ji River.
